result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Robert W. Klubertanz was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences Mr. Klubertanz to 4 years of Imprisonment, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2 years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2 years. This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 2:23pm [mo]
Defendant Robert W. Klubertanz in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of " No Contest  " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Klubertanz   guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State and Joint Recommendation of the Parties, the Court reads in and dismisses Count #2
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Count #1
The Court sentences Mr. Klubertanz   to  4  years of Imprisonment, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 2   years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 2  years  This sentence is to commence FORTHWITH

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

The Court gives   1  day credit for time already served.

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no operation of a motor vehicle without valid Drivers License and Agent Approval
--payment of all fines, costs and fees including subpoena fees incurred by the State
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--To pay fine of $1500 + costs= $2,958 plus blood testing costs in the amount of $56.74

The Court orders: 
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment 
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant

The Court determines that Mr. Klubertanz has previously provided a DNA sample and does not order another sample be taken
recess

DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess: 11:48am

the Defendant from the Sauk County Jail for the 10/27/15 STC
NOHs for DEF and Jail: 1) 9/16/15 PTC 2)10/27/15 STC//DEF. no longer at JEFCO, now at Sauk Co Jail
Original Bond Document received from JESO on 8/28/15, with attached note that DEF. was transported to Sauk County

Case called at 9:00am [mo]
Defendant Robert W. Klubertanz in court, in custody with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance

Mr.Klubertanz waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--no request for speedy trial 

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling

DA Happ raises that Mr. Klubertanz is not fitted with SCRAM monitoring due to his in custody status 
Atty. De La Rosa indicates that Mr. Klubertanz is in custody on a DOC hold on another matter, gives suggestions of amendment to bond language regarding SCRAM

The Court withdraws the Courts prior order for SCRAM as condition of bond, while the Mr.Klubertanz is in custody, shall the Mr.Klubertanz become otherwise able to be release from custody, WCS shall place a SCRAM monitor on Mr.Klubertanz before his release so long as that would not in any way delay his release, if that cannot be accomplished as a matter of logistics, Mr.Klubertanz should be released but report to the COC office the next business day in which the COC is open after his release for purposes of receiving a date and time for obtaining installation of SCRAM monitoring. 


NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 9/16/15 at 9:00am     (2) Status Conference on 10/27/15 at 8:30am

Case called at 1:52  [Clerk SH]
[Commissioner Michael Onheiber presiding for BrII]
Defendant Robert W. Klubertanz appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Sylvie Dahnert of the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Atty Dahnert informs the Court that Mr. Klubertanz is eligibile for SPD Services

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by State and requested by Defendant - Atty Dahnert indicates that Mr. Klubertanz is on a PO Hold

Court requires a $5000 signature bond, with conditions:
-  The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.
The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  The Defendant is to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on .  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.** 
-Absolute sobriety
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid license
Recess: 1:58 pm

NEXT: (1) Schedule Preliminary Hearing 8/24/15 at 9:00 am - Send notices
